- The Mansion, Farm, and former residence

ing about twenty-five acres Of fine arabic Land, sur
rounded with hedge and post and rail fence, in good
order. On the premises are choice selection Of
fruit Trees, with pleasant Gardens.


The improvements consist of large and COM
Portable two stored stone dwelling Honse, kitchens,
&C.; two storied brick house, formerly occupied
as an office, and recently as dwelling, stone barn
and stables, &c.


The situation of this estate is desirable one,
being high, healthy, and commanding delightful
view of the River Delaware, and surrounding conn'
try. For terms, application may be made tc
Thomas .MDo1peil, or Thomas Harrington, Will
mington, or the subscriber at Philadelphia.

TO ALL TEACHERS .ayND P.aRE.NTs.

THIS Institution will be opened on Monday


the 22d. Of October Inst, under the care
fthe Rev. JOSEPH W iLsoN.


In this Seminary students will be thoroughly in
structed in the different branches Of good English
and Classical Education, viz Reading, Writing
Arithmetic, English Grammar, Geography, Compo-
sitlon, Elocution, Mathematics, and the creek ana
Latin Languages The terms Of tuition will be for
the English branches, exclusive of Mathematics,
SO per session, or $40, including the Mathematics;
for the Languages, including the English, $40 per
session. Tuition money to be paid in advance.
There will be two sessions in the year, with a
short vacation between each.


Good boarding can be obtained in respectable
families in the village, at the rate Of Forty Dollars
per session and fe~ hpardcrs can be accommo-
dated in the family Of the Principal.


JOHN EDDOWES. Sec'y.

full articles.article:
THIS Institution will be opened on Monday


the 22d. Of October Inst, under the care
fthe Rev. JOSEPH W iLsoN.


In this Seminary students will be thoroughly in
structed in the different branches Of good English
and Classical Education, viz Reading, Writing
Arithmetic, English Grammar, Geography, Compo-
sitlon, Elocution, Mathematics, and the creek ana
Latin Languages The terms Of tuition will be for
the English branches, exclusive of Mathematics,
SO per session, or $40, including the Mathematics;
for the Languages, including the English, $40 per
session. Tuition money to be paid in advance.
There will be two sessions in the year, with a
short vacation between each.


Good boarding can be obtained in respectable
families in the village, at the rate Of Forty Dollars
per session and fe~ hpardcrs can be accommo-
dated in the family Of the Principal.


JOHN EDDOWES. Sec'y.
